result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Siegfried Almestica

defendant.name: Almestica, Siegfried

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 15CM1226 and 16CM78.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises he is still waiting on an offer from the DA.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cameron Weitzner appeared as prior counsel for the defendant.  Attorney Weitzner advises Attorney Kershek is now handling this case.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Court approves withdrawl of Attorney Weitzner.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the bad WCS reports.  Defendant may be under the influence of alcohol at this time.  State moves for additional cash bail.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements bail was never posted in this case, defendant was released from the hospital without posting bail.  Cashbail remains at $1,000.00.  Bail has not been previously posted.  Defendant taken into custody.  Court sets this case for a hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Siegfried Almestica
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: 137 E Park Ave,#1, Waukesha, WI 53186
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 3 ONLY
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with Samantha V. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Siegfried Almestica in court, in custody, with attorney Amber Rumpf for attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
